attributes.action: Celebrate Christmas in June by making Friday 25th and Monday 28th Bank Holidays.
attributes.additional_details: COVID restrictions have removed the ability for many families to get together and celebrate Christmas. By declaring 25th and 28th June as Bank Holidays this would give families a chance to reschedule their Christmas celebration in a more COVID-safe way. This would also give people something positive to focus on. The impact to the economy of the 2 extra Bank Holidays could be offset by increased consumer spending in the run up and during the Bank Holidays.
attributes.background: Declare Friday 25th June and Monday 28th June Bank Holidays in England

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564183
